revised_title: Anomalous Scattering in Helium and the Interaction Energy of Two -Particles
tldr: The authors study the interaction energy of two -particles at close distances using anomalous scattering in helium. They explain the deviation from the classical Coulombian scattering law and provide a mathematical model for the potential field. The results can be applied to the calculation of energy binding two -particles to form a stable nucleus.
